title: SIGHUP killing rclone serve instead of flushing directory caches

#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org`
N/A


#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
in [the docs for rclone serve http](https://rclone.org/commands/rclone_serve_http/#vfs-directory-cache), it states:

> You can send a SIGHUP signal to rclone for it to flush all directory caches, regardless of how old they are. Assuming only one rclone instance is running, you can reset the cache like this:
> ```
> kill -SIGHUP $(pidof rclone)
> ```

doing this just kills the server, instead of flushing the directory cache.

small sidenote: i'm trying to use SIGHUP instead of a remote control server because im going to have multiple instances of rclone serve, and dont want to have 4 http servers constantly running
